comments.body: Great Idea.
Building an atlas with a book would be way more useful than a dozen maps in one's inventory for sure, love the idea!
You could actually put in map art in each page. And then give it to your friends.
It's a good idea. I think this is definitely worth adding to the game
In the educational edition, there is something similar, there you can take photos using the camera and include them in the book.
Great idea, but maybe also ability to drawing and writing text on maps. With it you will be able to create named locations, like your base or your friends bases.
Please include things like: Kitchen appliances, Bathroom items (inc. mirror), mountable chairs, Living room items, curtains, outdoor furniture, lighting items
yeah awesome I want furniture plus more texture packs for free!
Sii Minecraft debe de tener muebles :D
the furniture I only get to craft is a bed I want to be able to have more options

I think it would be nice to have more furniture such as bedroom items like dressers and wardrobes, bathroom items like showers, sinks, toilets and soap. Kitchen items like cabinets, refrigerators, tables, chairs, utensils and dishes/pots and pans. Also living room items such as recliners, couches, tv and coffee tables.
Quiero tener muevles perÃ² no se como

Usable craft-able furniture would add a lot of value to Minecraft. Because buildings are a huge part of what makes Minecraft awesome. Having a variety of craft-able furniture that your character could interact with would make structures more unique.

Using existing blocks for makeshift furniture is great, but after awhile itâ€™s not as appealing as having real furniture and also appliances that you could build and install in structures.

Plus. The addition of usable craft-able furniture wouldnâ€™t entail a ton of added mechanics to implement. It wouldnâ€™t have any negative effects with any of the other game mechanics in Minecraft either.
Minecraft has said that they will never, ever add furniture of any kind.

I dont care about making anything too complicated. 

I literally just want chairs, tables and shelves of every wood type.

It shouldnt be terribly difficult either. At least the chairs shouldnt. 

 

Heck just give us chairs if nothing else.

I agree! Furniture in Minecraft would make houses and interior so much more enjoyable for people! Watching all these YouTubers with mods on makes me wish people who canâ€™t have mods had furniture in game!! Please Minecraft!!
I would like to see an update for furniture like couches, bathroom appliances and kitchen appliances to use on my realm on xbox
Added!!!!!

there should be things like real couches and chairs you can sit on, tables to put stuff on, wardrobe for armor, glass doors, more beds (loft beds, double beds, bunk beds; you could combine a banner and and a bed and the banner would be the blanket. if it were a bunk bed you could do two banners), curtains (put in on a loom and make patterns like on banners), and whatever else people can think of.

building is part of the backbone of Minecraft and furniture would make building houses and bases and stuff way more enjoyable and rewarding. and what if some people want to make modern stuff too but cant use mods or add-ons??

Add a furniture update that includes everything that in real life (but not guns) because I can't find any perfect add on and I want more furniture but make it so that it's not a mod and make it so it's an actual thing

I am not sure I agree with most things here. Nonetheless the idea is fabulous and if Mojang were to put some thought into it then it could become something spectacular
different types are a great idea but not THIS types
nice suggestion! Framing crops will be more dynamic with this

i also think each type of farmland should be better at growing certain crops like the podzol could be better at growing carrots than potato's like ether they grow faster or yield more from each harvest

I love this idea! The capability of different farmland options is amazing. I also agree that different farmland should help grow different foods. Like the podzol farm can make carrots grow faster. Definitely voting!

Perfect fit for the upcoming nether update!

I think this idea is great, however I have one suggestion. Growing something like wheat on soulsand will probably do something funky to the crop, since itâ€™s growing on completely alien soil. Maybe you could have nether variants of each crop, like wheat becoming fire reed or carrots becoming golden carrots (yes, this means you can grow golden carrots). These new food sources could behave slightly differently from their counterparts, like fire reed becoming lava bread, which restores less hunger points but gives you fire resistance (NOT IMMUNITY) for a short time.
I can see this as a new update! I wanted a farming rework and this is perfect!
I think that not only it brings back tamed animals but it could even bring back any mob with a name tag for example a villager or a fox

It hurts so much is precisely because it is forever. if a revive option would be added it would cheapen the experience in my opinion... I myself just lost my favorite fox to a skeleton :(

It would be very good, I spent so much time to tame my favourite mobs (parrots) and they drowned because a creeper's explosion knocked me into water. If this was added to bedrock edition too, I'd be very happy. Losing pets is a very painful experience indeed.

I would love that, my first puppy died, because an iron golem killed him, his name was Bob :(

I made him a huge funeral, with fireworks and bone statues.

Today my dog lil buddy fell in lava:(
I made a grave for him and in a spot beside it I put a chest and put a stack of bones in it
this would have been a very good idea if only i could understand ;0

yes yes yeeeeeessss.

 

maybe not just in a woodland mansion tho...they r usually super far and u have to travel at least a thousand blocks to go there. but I agree on it not being crafted, maybe in command and woodland mansion.(just an idea)

I think this would be great as a creative item. It is certainly painful to lose your pets to natural circumstances, but that is a pain that is real. It's an entirely different thing to kill all your pets because of a command screwup when writing commands. Natural Perma-death makes sense, but unnatural causes don't.

 

I was a couple thousand blocks from my village. I used a /kill command that was SUPPOSED to have a radius of 100, but instead killed all my pets and villagers back home! T-T

 

Good News: They didn't die after all, which is fantastic considering that the text log said "Milunka died" etc.

my pet llama billy died some how i was working on my vault when i noticed hes carpet was in my hands i was shocked by this i held a big funeral for him after that i was such a mix of feelings of sad and mad i killed my fish jimmy i will never forget you sweet billy never :{ .
i just lost my pet camel and idk what to do i miss him already
i just lost my pet camel and idk what to do i miss him already

I know there are people saying this would cheapen the experience, but in my opinion it would be really nice if there were the OPTION to cheapen said experience if the player so chooses. I have enough pain in my irl existence, and running away to fantasy is supposed to help with that not make it worse. I've just lost my irl pet budgie of fifteen years, and upon trying to eat a cookie in game I accidentally fed it to my parrot instead. And then cried for a good half hour. I understand that people would rather it not be super easy, but personally it would be just... really great if we could at least have a command to revive them, if not an item.

I just lost my cat Tingyun to fire idk why or how it happened in her room my friend refused. I made a grave and a memorial for her depslate bricks and 3 diamond blocks
And most importantly a totem of undying in a glowing item frame to get her to the sky safely 
Iâ€™ll miss Tingyun delay
Idk what to do now without Tingyun
I recently had 2 dogs in Minecraft named Furnace Minecraft and Barf Bag. In that same day, I lost my Chicken who was name tagged named Jermiah, please Minecraft, add this
Yes please add this my son is so sad he accidentally killed 2 horses.
my dog named neptune died by a endermen today and it was painful we need this in bedrock
Mojang said they're going to add things like burgers and pizza.
Maybe a variant??? Cheeseburger?
Burger tasty, burger yum
I hope they add burgers! If you added milk too, you could get a cheeseburger. A cheeseburger could heal 15 food points instead of just 14.
I think this is too modern.

Adding a recipe for cheese from milk and then the recipe to add cheese to the burger recipe for cheeseburgers would be the best. Maybe even add pork for a bacon cheeseburger? I don't think this is any more modern than a cake though.
Honestly it simply makes sense. I cant think of a good reason for obsidian to not get these variants.Polished walls would be nice, but I think that would deserve its own pole if nobody has yet.
Obsidian is my favorite block and it has been in the game for a long time. After the addition of the stonecutter there is no reason for there not to be a slab and stair and polished varient

I deeply agree, we could definetly use some decorative obsidian. I also had in mind a chiseled obsidian block, on the lines of sandstone blocks but end themed (I mean, red sandstone points to a boss, the Wither, so obsidian should point to the other boss, the End Dragon).

If obsidian masonry is made (polished, stair, slab, wall blocks), can weeping obsidian also have masonry blocks?

Also requesting pillar and chiseled obsidian/crying obsidian (crying obsidian pillars could be really pretty). You could also make the crying obsidian blocks look ruined and damaged, so you could have detailed obsidian ruins.
I really want to put obsidian stairs on the corners of my portals!
This idea makes sense, especially because Obsidian looks quite unlike how it looks in real life and Polished Obsidian could look more like how one would think the obsidian stone would look like.

I see It's been literally years since this thread was started and we still do NOT have Obsidian stairs, slabs, etc. I find this ridiculous given they've added Deep slate, etc to the game. Obsidian is difficult to work with so not everyone will use this but I know I'm not the only player asking for this option. Heck, I wouldn't even object if you had to use the Stone Cutter to make these Obsidian variants. C'mon Mojang! :)

I agree with others regarding the use of Obsidian stairs, slabs and walls. Maybe make us use the Stone Cutter or perhaps a special Diamond Stone Cutter? C'mon Mojang - we've been pleading for years about this one.
Also there should be obsidian bricks!
I love this idea
Good idea also could have a delay before your next swing like in java edition but much longer delay than a sword or an axe

For a weapon such as the hammer it could damage the area
A hate of texture is using a 3D would fit better in the hammer proposal that would be an interesting new weapon in a future update
Add hammer as a new weapon please

I love this idea. And just as an idea, Hammers could be used to pound dirt and grass blocks into slabs maybe, I think dirt, grass, and grass path slabs would be a great addition to the game for the creative players.
Coool
an extra ide might be hammers can be used as tools: use it to break glass instantly, make 3x3 tunnels by using a hammer instead of a pickaxe

THIS IS PERFECT!!! Would be cool if the blocks and bricks let light through without being transparent and also if it maybe was useful for some kind of potion too to give it an extra use.

Honestly the only change I would do is that it just keeps away some specific mobs like undead mobs and some others like creepers or something else so it's good for early game and base protection but that's it.

Honestly the only change I would do is that it just keeps away some specific mobs like undead mobs and some others like creepers or something else so it's good for early game and base protection but that's it."

 

Yes! I totally agree with keeping the Rock Salt Dust to a minimum of certain mobs, especially ones with rotting flesh. Of course not all hostile mobs would be affected by this. Thank you for pointing that out!

This feels very in-line with their existing â€œnew featureâ€ requirements: at least 2 new purposes! Your version of salt has plenty more! Enhanced food (probably only for meats?), storage block, buildng block, armor trim, light source, and lastly a weird one-off functionality that makes it unique (the mob warding stuff), plus unique worldgen requirements. I love this idea! I think Mojang would take interest in this, but they may for-go the mob warding feature. It feels a bit too mystical for vanilla. I would love to see it added as a way to manipulate mob pathing even further, I just donâ€™t know if Mojang would want to add it to vanilla.

One more idea for salt I just thought of - why not allow it to be used to â€œcureâ€ rotten flesh into leather? Maybe just via crafting, but could be a good way to implement a long-asked-for feature.

Reply to: "One more idea for salt I just thought of - why not allow it to be used to â€œcureâ€ rotten flesh into leather? Maybe just via crafting, but could be a good way to implement a long-asked-for feature."

Yes actually I love that idea, I remember thinking that rotten flesh could be cured by salt but didn't know what it'd be cured to, but that would be perfect!
EDIT!: I didn't really know the purpose of a grindstone until after I made this post, my bad! I think a better idea would be to just craft 9 Rock Salt Dust to create 4 Rock Salt Crystals!

Yes. Yes. Yes.
Cool idea
I love this idea, I could make some salt mazes in zombie farms, also I love the idea someone else said of being able to cure rotten flesh into leather.
Soul torches too
This would be great! Itâ€™s perfect for lighting up to new giant caves. What may happen to the torches if they get shot into water though?

This seems like a great idea, but I agree with what several people on the Reddit thread are saying: that this shouldn't actually place a torch, but instead work like a flare gun, emitting light and possibly fire particles for a certain amount of time before "going out" and despawning. This would involve these "flares" being entities and emitting light, which Mojang hasn't done before, but with Glow Squids confirmed and set to be released, this shouldn't be an issue...?
If they collide with water, they should drop as an item
maybe if they hit water they turn into charcoal
Perfect, an amazing alternative to something like the flame enchant on the crossbow!

The addition of torch arrows to Minecraft can be seen as a response to player needs for more dynamic and versatile tools for exploration and combat. Here are several reasons why torch arrows were introduced:

  1. Illumination from a Distance: Torches are a fundamental tool in Minecraft for lighting up dark areas to prevent hostile mob spawns and to see clearly. Torch arrows allow players to light up areas from a distance, which is particularly useful in deep caves or ravines where it's risky to approach closely.

  2. Exploration Efficiency: When exploring new terrains or cave systems, players can use torch arrows to mark paths, highlight points of interest, or light up distant targets without needing to traverse dangerous or difficult terrain immediately. This makes exploration faster and safer.

  3. Strategic Combat: In combat scenarios, especially against mobs that spawn in the dark, torch arrows offer a way to strategically light up areas to reduce mob spawns while still engaging in combat. This can be especially useful in situations where placing torches by hand would be too slow or dangerous.

  4. Enhanced Gameplay Mechanics: Adding new items like torch arrows introduces fresh gameplay mechanics and strategies. It encourages players to think creatively about how they explore, combat, and interact with the Minecraft world, keeping the game experience engaging and varied.
It should be the size of a block but when clicked on it rolls out into a flat 2x1 area

This is a necessary edition. A japanese youtuber I watch plays the game blind. He's series does a good job highlighting features in the game that are missing. He can't go long distances without a phantom attacking him because if he sleeps it will reset his spawnpoint.
this would be great for exploring

This would fit perfectly into 1.19! Mojang seems to want us to go out exploring, and a way to sleep without resetting one's spawn would be quite useful for that. Implementing it in the form of sleeping bags would fit the vibe they seem to be going for with the Wild Update quite well.

Beds are good for sleeping while travelling, but I haven't thought that they do reset another spawning point too, as well they are more likely to be a furniture piece. I've been thinking that sleeping bags could work the same for the same purpose, without resetting another spawning point now that you mention, but also a way for sleep straightforwardly without placing any block at all if urgently one needs to sleep by simply using it from the hand.

I like the idea of it not resetting your spawn, so it just acts as a mobile bed. The crafting recipe could be one of the following three ideas: a) 6 wool, b) 6 carpets, or c) a combination of 3 leather and 3 wool/carpets. The carpets or wool would need to be of all the same color, same as the requirement for beds.

I think it should be able to reset your spawn for 1 use or until picked up that way if your mining or something far down and die you could retrieve your loot quickly and I think it should use wool or hay blocks or maybe just wheat or string somewhere in crafting
bag / or half current bed - could auto re-enter your inventory when morning came.

I was thinking it would soft spawn set. If you leave it placed then you can respawn there once, youâ€™d have to place it down again to reset the cycle and if you donâ€™t then your next death would be at the last bed.
Would be cool if this also healed the frostbite effect.
Also, villagers shouldnt be able to use it. Player only

with how they encourage exploration and even phantoms attacking when you don't sleep it seems really necessary to have sleeping bags to travel and sleep and not reset your spawn point. it makes since to me.

Id like it to be something that you can do just by holding it in your hand too. not having to place down the block then interact with it. just would be better for traveling and keep it more separate from beds. but I could see crouching and clicking making it stay on the ground for decoration and making camps across your land for traveling too.

A way to keep phantoms away while exploring without resetting spawn. Phantoms keep the player bound to an area, which just doesn't allow exploration easily. Could give the bag durability or something to make sure there is Some incentive to go back or use a normal bed.
Might require a campfire (stove) and also require a large "You can't sleep while there are monsters" range.
Crafted with 3 wool on top and 3 leather below- just like a bed, but instead of wood, there is leather
Genius!
I had this exact same idea lol

This NEEDS to be added. Such a great idea.

This would be greatly appreciated! I love landscaping in my builds, especially making window boxes of flowers, but having one flower per block just looks sparse and quite silly. Having them stack like Sea Pickles or Turtle Eggs would be amazing.
This would be awesome!  It would make flower gardens look like gardens, rather than sad collections of singular flower stems.
Nice.  I never thought of that before.  It makes sense.
You have my approval!
I had the exact same idea, if you could do this flower meadows would be plausible. Ever look at a flower forest and feel like something is off or something is missing, it think it's this!

Add mushrooms and ferns, too. 
Mixing flowers would be a really cool thing, as well.
Upvoted , i wanted to submit my own thread with this idea. Now candles have the same feature, flowers should have it too.

I've wanted this for a long time now. Gardens currently look great, but a little strange because of the space between each flower, especially when you get up close. I disagree about the Azure Bluets though, I think they could still benefit from this.

One of the focuses of the 1.19 Wild Update is the atmosphere; I think this feature would fit well in that update. I think flowers in the wild would probably tend to be less clumped unless it's somewhere like a flower forest.
I need this I've wanted this for soo lonh
No.  The reason Minecraft is great is because of the low resolution.  Raising Minecraft's resolution by adding more stairs and slabs lowers the value of Minecraft.
I love this idea, i was going to do it myself. But when I saw this post only had 31 votes, it made me sad that it didn't have more. I WANT IT IN THE GAME. You have my vote
Craftable dirt slabs and stairs would be interesting, especially if they can become grass or mycelium slabs or stairs in the same conditions that a dirt block can.
More stairs!! Dirt and everything! And slab it up too why not.
This would be great for map builders and so on as you could make dirt/grass pathways that go up and down on different levels instead of having to switch to wood/stone stairs

I noticed it's 2yrs in since this was posted, but yes. 100% yes. We need dirt "slabs" and "stairs" even if they had a different name. Stone doesn't make fences. It makes walls. They could be labeled as something like "dirt mound" and "dirt step". Someone commented that MC doesn't need more resolution. It's not an argument of resolution, it's an argument for the general creativity that wouldn't drastically effect anything. Don't like it? Don't use it. Thing is with something like a dirt slab or stair, you could have some lovely Terraforming. I don't necessarily think it should be incorporated in world generation so much, but definitely something manmade. You could change the gradient change of a Prairie to be more gradual. Or have more flowing hills as you approach your base. As you develop the are around your base you could slowly add and change the lands around to flow better. It'd be a nice change instead of having to slam the spacebar the entire time while wondering around your world.
Dirt stairs are my absolute top thing that I want to be added to the game!! I feel like they would really improve my builds and I don't feel like they're unrealistic in the world of minecraft!
I think it would be weird to have dirt stair/slabs and don't think it they should put it in the game and instead focus on other features.
Or at least a dirt slab
I understand the want for more slabs/stairs/etc., but, well, dirt?!?!?!

I don't think I would want all the dirt-like blocks to have slabs and stair variants, but I REALLY think that dirt-path blocks should have slab (and possibly stair) variants. These should just be an additional click or two with the shovel when making paths. This would make paths more path-like in terms of smooth movement, which makes so much sense to me. The other blocks, to me, don't really need the added complexity, although I WOULD love moss carpets to stack like snow does. This would make it the warm-weather version of what snow layers can do.

Instead I think if you use bone meal on cobblestone NEXT to mossy cobblestone it will spread. Similar to the nether grass stuff
you could also use an anvil to merge an elytra and a chestplate together so you will have full armour.
also, it would be fun, that if you added 2 sticks to the elytra, you would be able to slow down by pressing [S]

I like the idea of using the anvil to combine the Elytra with a chestplate. It does look silly when you're wearing all armour and decide to wear an Elytra - it's almost like having a "bald" spot. Please make this possible Mojang! I think this would looke really cool!

I just think you SHOULD be able to wear armor and elytra at the same time. And ya I get your back could get busy holding elytra, armor, capes (mabe even back packs or inventories, idk) but I guarantee that Steve won't lose his posture.

Even if it doesn't give the full protection of the armor type you'd combine it with, it'd be great to balance out the way armor looks when wearing it with elytra. I think making the armor elytra provides minimal (similar to that armor set's boots) or no armor would make sense since as it currently stands, elytra is already a pretty op item.

A enchantment book that lets you connect a chest plate and elytra together with an anvil.

Chest plate and enchantment book then chest plate with elytra. Or elytra and enchantment book then elytra with chest plate.

Also be able to use stone cutter so you can uncombine them to upgrade with a another chestplate.

If combined with diamond chestplate be able to upgrade with netherite ingot without disenchanting the chestplate or elytra and re enchant it.

It might be enough just to allow protection enchant on elytra actually. This way they are still weaker but makes it easier to defend against creepers. Guaranteeing not being one-hit on hard currently requires two blast protection pieces if elytra is on (full proc 4 is enough with chestplate) so you become much more vulnerable to other mobs (especially vindicators)
It probably would b better if the elytra had it's own item slot so u could use full armor and elytra at the same time.

that would be really cool!

So Us "Humans" have Netherite Armor To protect us, But what about horses? The best armor they can get is diamond! So if horses had Netherite Armor, they have more protection. Please add Netherite Horse Armor.

I really support being able to enchant horse armor. Specifically, horse armor should be able to get the "Frost Walker" enchantment. As a transportation option, I feel that horses need some kind of improvement to be able to compete with the other options. Being able to cross bodies of water would not only make them a more desirable transportation option but it would also make Frost Walker a more desirable enchantment.
Came to post a similar idea, this includes all I could possibly think of :)
Frost Walker
I like this because you could finally use horses in pvp
trims :D

"and could be found only in bastions" strongly disagree with this, keep the horse armor loot tables as they are and only add Netherite Horse Armor as an upgrade to diamond horse armor on a smithing table, they same way you upgrade all other diamond gear
Yes, I would love this addition, horses are so forgotten
There are no horses in Nether. Bastions cannot have horse armor.
It would instead be better if horse armor was craftable. And then upgrade it to netherite. Also, replace Float with Frost Walker and add Thorns.
it would make sense if you could use a netherite upgrade on diamond horse armor to make netherite horse armor. this would fix the problem of horses not being in the nether.

I LOVE this idea!!

I've been wondering for a while why this has not happed yet. Horse armor is the only armor that you cannot enchant.. nor has a netherite upgrade (from diamond). Not only would it let horse PVP be an option, it would greatly improve in game battles as well (ex: Villager Raids)

I think keeping in a bastion is a cool choice.. however i think having it be craftable from diamonds with a smithing table should also be an option.

I think adding Frost Walker as an enchantment would benefit greatly as well. Though personally i think they should just have horses be able to swim. I mean you wouldn't think it, but horses are in fact really great swimmers! They have a natural instinct (like most animals) to start swimming once they hit deep water, plus huge lungs that keep them buoyant.

I would like to add something, if you don't mind, to that list of enchantments. (This is quite brilliant by the way; I was just about to post about enchantments on horse armor when I saw this post) 

There should be a new enchantment added, that only goes on horse armor. Perhaps it could be called... actually I have no ideas for names, but it is an enchantment that allows you to ride your horse in water. maybe it could be like depth strider, where the higher levels actually make the horse faster in water than on land, but I just wanted to tell you how mad I get when my horse dumps me into the ocean. Thank you!

however netherite horse armor should be also, or even only, craftable same as netherite human armor is, netherite upgrade, diamond armor and ingot in smithing table

I think this idea is very good and definitely deserves more attention. I think the block breaker and placer would work best as blocks of their own. I like the idea of the block breaker using a tool given to it to break the blocks, so it takes time to break a block (instead of being instant) and it also affects the tool durability, so I think it is not overpowered. The block breaker and block placer would allow us to make our farms more automatic and we wouldn't have to rely on silly bugs like TNT duplication.

Honestly, I'd be happy to just have dispensers use picks/blocks instead of throwing them. I think the best way to incorporate a copper toolset would be for it to be in between stone and iron. The armor and tools would oxidize, which would make it so that you had to repair or replace it frequently. Especially since stone doesn't have a corresponding armor (unless you count chainmail, which can't be obtained very easily) it would be good to have an armor between leather and iron, and copper has basically no uses, despite being really common.
